text: Hi Team, In the attached custom CrmPropertyList component, is there any chance to change the label name "Create Date" to "Contact Create Date" and the date format should be YY-MM-DD?
Hi team, I created an application and the app is showing on the right bar of my production account. Do you know if it's possible to add it in the middle of the page?
so in my case i have a example-card.json with this json in it
After setting the location to "crm.record.tab" you can press the "Customize Tabs" and then create a new tab and then add your card to the tab

Hi <@U04L9MBL308>, the property list pulls the label and format from the property definition so any changes would need to be made there.

Although, I believe `createdate` is a HubSpot defined property and the label is immutable. The format of the date is based on locale and should be consistent at the portal level.
Hi <@U0636P3PF5W> thank you for your reply :pray: How can I do it with an application I created from a dev account? : I'm a little bit confused between UI extension and CRM card :confused:
No worries! Have you checked this guide?  <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extensions-quickstart>
And this: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-extensions-overview>
I might have misunderstood what you are trying to do :sweat_smile: I can't say i recognize that part very much!

Hmm, I guess what I did was not very common :sweat_smile: I created my app from a developer account, but I don't have the possibility to customise it as I want for the location because I have no access to the code So I guess we'll need to do an UI extension :woman-shrugging:

Hello everyone! We have an exciting update to share :mega:
*What?* :memo:
We've redesigned our *<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-components|UI Component docs>* to make them more easy to use. Changes to look out for:
:star: A separate page for each component
:star: Design guidelines for each specific component within its own page
:star: Table for prop specs for each component for easier reference
:star: Components directly accessible through the sidebar
:star: Clear visuals for component variants
:star: A "new" tag to highlight the recently launched components

*Why?*:thinking_face: We wanted all the component-related info to live together for easier reference. We know how much you use these docs and we want to ensure it's a smooth experience to build with components as we keep adding to this list:rocket:

*What to expect?*:eyes:
No changes are needed from your side. The previous doc links should automatically be replaced by the new docs. This change is already reflected in the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-components|public docs> and <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/ui-components/overview|beta docs>. The in-app docs will have this shortly.

Let us know about your experience below:smile:
mmm IMO having a separate page for each component makes it harder to navigate
<@UV23JHEJY> we appreciate that feedback. Would love to know more, can you elaborate?

When I have to build a new card I usually go into that page and browse all components (visually) to see wich one can fit my use case better, with this update I'm forced to open each component to see how that component looks like

Ah, that's a great point. We have been working on making it easier to visualize our components all at once. An upcoming update we're working on is our <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/product-updates/?query=figma&update=13932250|Figma library >to make the experience of viewing and choosing components easier.

I'd love to know if something like this would help with your use case. Let me know if you'd want to get early access to test this out :slightly_smiling_face:

A little bit more on why we've made this change:
• For more complex components like <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-components/table|Table> and <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/ui-components/panel|Panel> which have subcomponents, it was difficult to present and consume so much information together. This would lead to confusion about how to use the component too. We wanted to smoothen this experience
• Previously, the design guidelines were siloed away from the components and difficult to put on a page that was already so long
• As we expand our component set, we wanted these docs to be scalable and for it to be easy to jump from one component to the other
We hear you about wanting to see all the components at a glance. I have noted this feedback and am curious if this problem persists even with the Figma. Thank you for keeping us honest and looking forward to more feedback on how this experience is for you :smile:

Not sure if anyone has experienced this, but I have a client who is facing a strange issue: after loading the record, when the page/card is loading it shows for a second, and then seconds later the whole page hangs. This is only happening when the right association bar is open. When the association bar is  closed it is working as expected.

Even stranger thing is I am unable to replicate this on my end. We've tried all the typical troubleshooting steps, clear cache, updated chrome, I also reviewed the console/network logs. I haven't looked into see if there are any extensions that conflict, but it's just strange it is only happening when the right associations bar is open on the record page.

Any suggestions/thoughts?

Edit: I also know that there is a 10s timeout limit on serverless functions, but doesn't seem this is related as the function is firing OK.
One thing you could try, to isolate the problem, is to remove the sidebar cards one by one and see when the problem goes away. Then hopefully that will find the problem card.
Thanks Danny, let me give this a shot.
Public apps… created from Dev accounts… like the one you created can only be displayed on the side panel <@U05UAR9DR27>
Thanks <@U05ENUJF7B5> for your quick response. but my requirement is chnage the lable name and date format.can you pls advice
Would love to see that figma library, but I think adding just a little gif near the component name and description in the docs would make the whole page easier to browse
